lead_paragraph: HOLQUIST--J. Michael. His wife Elise Snyder and his sons mourn the passing of J. Michael Holquist, emeritus professor of Comparative Literature at Yale University and past president of the MLA. He died in his sleep at home early on the morning of Sunday, June 26, 2016. Born in Rockford, Illinois, on December 20, 1935, he served in the US Army (where he learned Russian). He received a BA from the University of Illinois and a PhD from Yale University, where he helped establish the undergraduate literature major, Lit X. After serving as chair of Slavic Departments at the University of Texas, Austin and Indiana University-Bloomington, he returned to Yale, where he taught from 1986-2005. In his retirement, he taught in the Society of Senior Scholars at Columbia University and the Yale Alumni College--and also ran a wine importing business with his wife. He is survived by his widow, Elise Snyder; his sons Peter, Benjamin, Nicholas, and Sebastian; and his stepdaughters Katherine Snyder and Margaret Hamilton. He was predeceased by his son Joshua. The funeral will be private. A memorial service will be held at the Riverside Memorial Chapel on September 25, 2-4pm. 1
